definition.featurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="feature_container" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><value name="feature"><block type="feature_bamboo"><field name="probability">0</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_count"><comment pinned="false" h="105" w="222">Placement modifiers are processed from top to bottom. We try to place 4 trees in each chunk</comment><value name="count"><block type="int_provider_constant"><field name="value">4</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_in_square"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="189">We then move each tree horizontally, so that they don't generate in the corner of the chunk</comment><next><block type="placement_surface_water_depth"><field name="depth">0</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is how deep the water can be for the tree to generate. If the value is 0, the tree will never be submerged</comment><next><block type="placement_heightmap"><field name="heightmap">OCEAN_FLOOR</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We then move each feature to the highest solid block (which might be underwater)</comment><next><block type="placement_biome_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="85" w="210">We check that the tree doesn't generate in the wrong biome</comment><next><block type="placement_block_survival_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">Finally, we check if the position is actually valid. Trees should generate only on blocks that support their sapling.</comment><value name="block"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">Blocks.BAMBOO</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the block used to check for the tree position. Generally it should be the sapling of the tree.</comment></block></value></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
